benchmark_details.name: LongDocURL
benchmark_details.overview: LongDocURL is a comprehensive benchmark integrating three primary tasks: Long Document Understanding, Numerical Reasoning, and Cross-Element Locating, comprising 20 sub-tasks and utilizing a dataset of 2,325 question-answering pairs covering more than 33,000 pages of documents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating the document understanding capabilities of large vision language models (LVLMs) and to address the limitations of existing benchmarks in handling long documents and complex elements.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The types of documents in this benchmark are limited, and a broader range of data sources could enhance evaluation.

data.source: Collection of over 396 documents crawled from CommonCrawl and other sources.
data.annotation: Semi-automated pipeline with both automated and human verification phases.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correct answers extracted from the predicted responses.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better performance in understanding and reasoning over document elements.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive evaluation experiments conducted with 26 different configurations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Proper measures have been taken for data anonymity and user privacy.
